title: What is the oldest tree in the USA? - Quora

response.answer_text: bristlecone pine tree The researchers say the bald cypress are oldestknown living trees in eastern North America and the oldest known wetland tree species in the world. As for the oldest known living tree in the whole of NorthAmerica, that honor goes to a bristlecone pine tree in California, estimated at over 4,800 years old.

The oldest tree in the USA is some 5000 years old. Impressive. But the Wallemi Pine in Australia, known only by fossils until recently when a living one was found, is 200 MILLION YEARS old. It was around for much of the time when dinosaurs roamed the world. It is a single genetic type, just like you. It propagates underground and comes up as clones. You can buy and grow one.
